motion_phases.description: The agent moves their hand toward the object (e.g., food) and the cutting tool (e.g., knife) on the surface.
The agent securely grasps the cutting tool (e.g., knife) with an appropriate grip, preparing to cut.
The agent positions the knife over the object to be cut, ensuring proper alignment for the cut.
The agent applies downward pressure on the knife, starting the cutting motion with controlled force.
The agent continues the cutting motion, applying consistent pressure and guiding the knife through the object.
The agent completes the cut, ensuring the object is divided into the desired parts.
The agent releases the cutting tool (e.g., knife) and lifts it away from the object, completing the task.
